p: A study modeling E. coli transport in the STA at 20°C and 23°C found greater attenuation at the higher temperature, but predicted lower E. coli removal under simulated increases in rainfall leading to wetter soils [ 34]. These two effects were not coupled in the model; since we observed lower FCB attenuation in our experiment, this would suggest that the degree of soil moisture plays a larger role in bacterial removal than temperature.
